author: Brian WindhorstESPN Senior Writer
description: Kyrie Irving scored at will against the Boston Celtics, saving the Cavaliers from LeBron James' foul trouble and ultimately putting a stamp on Game 4.
title: How Kyrie Irving dominated Game 4

author: Jeff Zillgitt
description: Kyrie Irving scored a playoff career-high 42 points in the Cavs' Game 4 win over the Celtics.
title: Kyrie Irving put Cavaliers on his back when it mattered most

author: Jerry Bembry
description: J.R. Smith was the first to reach Kyrie Irving after the final buzzer, dapping up his backcourt mate before giving him a hug. From there the Cleveland Cavaliers, one by one, did the same, ending wi…
title: Kyrie Irving keeps the Cavaliers on point against Celtics

author: Jeff Zillgitt
description: Kyrie Irving had 21 points on 9-of-10 shooting in the third quarter and the Cavaliers pulled away to take a 3-1 series lead over the Celtics.
title: Kyrie Irving drops 42, powers Cavaliers to Game 4 win over Celtics

author: TOM WITHERS
description: CLEVELAND (AP) — Kyrie Irving gritted his teeth, tightened up his left sneaker and hopped to his feet. The pain couldn't stop him. The Celtics couldn't either. Irving took over in the second half and finished with 42 points despite playing on a tender ankle, LeBron James added 34 and the Cleveland Cavaliers moved within one win of an almost inevitable third date in the NBA Finals with Golden State by rallying to beat Boston 112-99 on Tuesday night in Game 4 of the Eastern Conference finals. With James in foul trouble, Irving was forced to do more than ever and he delivered, scoring 19 in less than five minutes and 33 in a 19-minute stretch.
title: Kyrie-markable: Irving's 42 carries Cavaliers past Celtics

author:
Nick Schwartz                    

                                    
                        @nick_schwartz
description: Skip Bayless said Kyrie Irving proved he may be the real King of the Cavs.
title: Skip Bayless and Shannon Sharpe react to the Cavaliers' comeback against the Celtics | FOX Sports

author: Chris ForsbergESPN Staff Writer
description: While LeBron James and Kyrie Irving carried the Cavaliers after halftime, the Celtics couldn't respond, especially without their one true superstar.
title: Without Isaiah Thomas, Celtics crumble as Cavaliers' stars step up

author: Dave McMenaminESPN Staff Writer
description: The Celtics had a 16-point lead in the second quarter, but a scoring eruption from Kyrie Irving has the Cavaliers up 3-1 after Cleveland won Game 4.
title: Irving, James turn the tables on Celtics with comeback of their own

author: Zach LoweESPN Senior Writer
description: Zach Lowe goes deep inside the most dangerous version of the NBA's most dangerous play: Kyrie Irving and LeBron James in a 1-3 pick-and-roll. Well, at least until Steph Curry and Kevin Durant decide to finally unleash it in Golden State.
title: Zach Lowe: How LeBron and Kyrie orchestrate the NBA's scariest play
